content.description:
The Wave goes up the rolling face of sandstone directly to the left of the wave's arete. Start at the undercling at waist level and make big moves up to the blob-like jug.

Be careful on the arete! The stone is very delicate.
content.location: Located at the far right side of The Wave, furthest from the ocean.

content.description:
Traverse The Wave from the far left all way way to the arete.

Turn the arete and climb the easy honeycombs to the top.

Guidebook says V2.. yeah I'm gonna say it was way harder than that.
Climb the flakes about 5 feet left of The Wave. Grab the jug at the top and go for it!
content.location: 5ft to the left of The Wave

content.description: Start on the tafoni on the far left of the Wave boulder. Move up past the hole to more tafoni and eventually a good sloping right hand. Get your feet up and top out via the large tafoni-covered tufa up top. Great area warmup.
content.location: 10 feet left of the Wave route, same boulder

content.description: Sit start on the shelf and climb straight up and slightly left to the brain hold. The Crux is finding the hidden crimps on the seam in order to get the brain. Nice grippy holds that feel sharp after climbing for a while.
content.protection: More than one crash pad at least and come at the lowest tide possible.
content.location: If in between the two boulders walk out and to the right there will be the first brain thing sort of high on the wall (Third from the last brain (farthest from the ocean)
